cont.entity_a: Comfortable to use over hearing aids. Not as comfortable as Bose headphones. Uncomfortable for long periods due to tightness and warmth. Earcups cover ears comfortably even with glasses. Comfortable fit for long periods.
cont.entity_b: Comfortable enough to forget they're on. Comfortable with good digital sound. Short range and loose fit on the head.

cont.entity_a: Sound quality is clear and good for listening to interviews. Audio is muddy and muffled, requiring equalizer adjustments. Requires an amp to enhance sound quality. Better sound quality and lighter design available in other models. Good sound quality for the price. Light and adjustable with good sound quality.
cont.entity_b: Sound quality isn't great but works well. Good for use with digital optical output. Optical cable setup provides Dolby 5.1 surround sound. Background hiss is noticeable. Background hiss from cheap amp. Implementation of Dolby functions is poor.

cont.entity_a: Great sound cancellation and comfort. Does not isolate outside noises well.
Durability issues with plastic flaking and channel stopping. Cord broke after a few months.
Collapsible design is convenient for transport. Heavy and bulky design. Instructions for folding are misleading. Made in China with discrepancies in instructions.
Volume control on the headphones is a useful feature. Volume control is useful for adjusting sound level without device adjustment.
cont.entity_b: Volume control could be easier to use.

cont.entity_a: Long cord is convenient but can cause tripping. Jack does not fit tightly into MP3 player.

cont.entity_b: Battery life is excellent. Significant static build-up as battery life diminishes.
Difficult to charge due to tricky base placement.
Limited range from the base. Range issues with signal drop even when near the receiver.
Allows TV volume to remain on for others.
